captions.text:
[ Mr. Hand ]
tn 1 898,
Spain owned Cuba outright.
Think about it.

Cuba owned by a disorganized
parliament 4,OOO miles away.

Cubans were in
a constant--

Cubans were in
a constant state of revolt.

the United States decided
to throw weight around--

Who is it?
Mr. Pizza Guy.

Again?
Mr. Pizza Guy, sir.
[ Class Giggling ]

- Who ordered the double cheese
and sausage?
- Right here, dude.
Foryou, dude.

Am l hallucinating?
What in the hell
doyou thinkyou're doing?

Learning about Cuba,
and having some food.

Mr. Spicoli, you're on
dangerous ground.

You're causing
a major disturbance
on my time.

l've been thinking about this,
Mr. Hand.

lfl'm here and you're here,
doesn't that make it
''our'' time?

There's nothing wrong
with a feast on ''our'' time.

You're absolutely right.
l t is our time.

Yours, mine and
eveyone else's in this room.

But it is my class.
Hamilton, Brandt,
Cornfeld, up front!

Mr. Spicoli has been kind enough
to bring us a snack.

Be my guest.
Help yourselves.
Get a good one.

comments.author: Staycee

comments.text:
Wow, this scene seems so quaint now.  When this film first came out, I 
remember thinking it was a real act of rebellion to order a pizza and have 
it delivered in class.  I wasn't the only one either.  What would happen 
today?  There's no way the teacher would take the pizza away from the kid 
for fear of being physically attacked or getting verbally assaulted.  More 
than likely, the teacher would just ignore the obnoxious punk and 
the snickering class while making a pathetic attempt to continue the 
lesson--of course that is assuming the pizza made it to the class; and the 
delivery guy wasn't taken down by a tactical team for entering school 
property without permission.  Welcome to the year 2015.﻿
comments.author: Fart Warrior

comments.text: +sha11235 Interesting, thanks for sharing.
comments.author: Fart Warrior

comments.text:
+Fart Warrior The irony about that scene was that originally during Cameron 
Crowe's research for his book, it was the person who inspired Rat that 
ordered the pizza in class. What happened was he was in a lab class and 
there was a phone in the office and he just decided to do it. Unlike Mr. 
Hand, the teacher didn't care and he even got a piece. Crowe had to change 
it to this because it wouldn't be funny otherwise. Read about this years 
ago, by the way.
comments.author: sha11235

comments.text:
+Andrew Sindler  You've missed my entire point.  I am in no way advocating 
that schools adapt a prison system of control.  In fact, it's just the 
opposite.  I'm merely being nostalgic and longing for a time when life 
seemed uncomplicated.  I think that's why most of us came to watch this 
clip.  The intent of my comment was not to make a political statement but 
to point out the irony of watching it in 2015.
comments.author: Fart Warrior

comments.text:
God, you are FULL of shit.  Let me guess: You think Ron Paul will save 
America.  You're one of those, am I right?

Last year a 6 year old elementary school boy almost had assault charges 
brought against him by a local school board for kissing a girl in school 
(Anyone remember this?  Hunter Yelton in Colorado Springs.) and your 
interpretation of school today is that it is too permissive.  Well, that is 
because you are either a NUT or you are too IGNORANT and STUPID to make 
simple observations from current events.  I'm a whole lot older than you 
and can testify that public schools were far more lax 30 and 40 years ago 
than they are now.   You could skip class, even a day of school without 
serious problems.  You could touch other students, get into fights, etc., 
without fear of suspension or expulsion.  If you misbehaved you were told 
to leave the classroom, or were sent to the principal, and there was also 
detention.   Zero tolerance and that other crap means public schools are 
run like day prisons.  Not figuratively.  They have many similarities to 
how prisons and mental institutions are run.

Too bad there are so many people like you who cannot seem to think straight 
enough to notice what has been going over the past few decades.
comments.author: Andrew Sindler

year. At the end he tells him that he'll probably "squeak by" with a 
passing grade and wishes him well!! Hand is OK in my book!!﻿
